chooseEncounterType: Choose an encounter type to link your form to
descriptionPlaceholderText: e.g. A form used to collect encounter data for clients in the Express Care program.
enterPageTitle: Enter a title for your new page
errorCopy: Sorry, there was a problem displaying this information. You can try to reload this page, or contact the site administrator and quote the error code above.
expandSectionExplainer: Below are the sections linked to this page. Expand each section to add questions to it.
formRendererHelperText: Load a form schema in the Schema Editor to the left to see it rendered here by the Form Engine.
interactiveBuilderHelperText: The Interactive Builder lets you build your form schema without writing JSON code. The Preview on the right automatically updates as you build your form. When done, click Save Form to save your form.
isQuestionRequiredOrOptional: Is this question a required or optional field? Required fields must be answered before the form can be submitted.
name: Name
noFormsToDisplay: There are no forms to display.
noMatchingConcepts: No concepts were found that match
pageExplainer: Pages typically have one or more sections. Click the button below to add a section to your page.
questionIdExists: This question ID already exists in your schema
questionIdPlaceholder: Enter a unique ID e.g. "anaesthesiaType" for a question asking about the type of anaesthesia.
saveAsModal: Would you want to update the form or save as a new version?
saveExplainerText: Clicking the Save button saves your form schema to the database. To see your form in your frontend, you first need to publish it. Click the Publish button to publish your form.
saveSuccessMessage: was created successfully. It is now visible on the Forms dashboard.
schemaError: There's an error in your schema.
sectionExplainer: A section will typically contain one or more questions. Click the button below to add a question to this section.
unpublishConfirmation: Are you sure you want to unpublish this form?
unpublishExplainerText: Unpublishing a form means you can no longer access it from your frontend. Unpublishing forms does not delete their associated schemas, it only affects whether or not you can access them in your frontend.
validFieldTypeRequired: A valid field type value is required
welcomeText: Welcome to the Interactive Schema builder! Add pages, sections and questions to your form. The Preview on the right automatically updates as you build your form. When done, click Save Form to save your form.
